"Shark Tale" is an entertaining animated film with a star-studded cast, featuring characters like Oscar (voiced by Will Smith) and his unlikely friendship with a fish named Lenny (Robert De Niro).

On the other hand, "Jingle All the Way" is a heartwarming holiday comedy about a father's quest to find a popular toy for his son, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger as the doting dad. Enjoy either of these movies!

I'd highly recommend watching "Hugo". It's a captivating adventure set in 1930s Paris, featuring an orphan who discovers a mystery involving his late father and an automaton. The movie is filled with charm and brings together a star-studded cast including Ben Kingsley, Sacha Baron Cohen, and Asa Butterfield.

If you're looking for something more family-oriented, "Despicable Me 2" might be right up your alley! It's a fun-filled movie that follows Gru, the world's most super-bad turned super-dad as he recruits his lovable minions to stop an evil villain. Steve Carell provides the voice for Gru in this heartwarming and humorous tale. Enjoy!

Based on your preference for language (Afrikaans Language) and the intrigue you expressed about the kind of story, I'd highly recommend "I Heart Huckabees." This film is a unique blend of comedy, drama, and philosophy as it explores existential questions that often keep us awake at night. One of its standout stars is Dustin Hoffman, who plays a detective helping others find answers to life's mysteries. Enjoy the thought-provoking journey!

If you're interested in historical dramas with an emphasis on language, Mansfield Park (1814) is also worth checking out. Set in the early 19th century, it tells the story of a young woman navigating her way through high society, as she was born into a poor family but sent to live with a wealthy uncle.
